Key Match Events: Rasmus Hojlund missed the best chance for the Danes
Aleksandar Mitrovic slid a late chance wide
Sergej Milinkovic-Savic could only strike tamely at Kasper Schmeichel in injury time
Christian Eriksen, whose 133rd cap made him the most capped Danish player of all time, brought a comfortable save out of Predrag Rajkovic from long range
Hojlund tested Rajkovic again then missed arguably Denmark’s best chance of the first half as he appeared to slip when shaping to shoot
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark had the best of the first half chances
The Serbians looked to step up a gear at the start of the second half
Half time substitutes Dusan Tadic and Luka Jovic injected some pace into the Serbian front line
Miscellaneous Highlights: Serbia needed a win to qualify but left it too late to push for a last 16 spot
Denmark ground out the goalless draw they needed against Serbia to clinch second place in Group C and advance to the knockout stages of Euro 2024
Aleksandar Mitrovic found the roof of the net with a header
Others: Denmark bundled the ball into the net on 23 minutes but the referee ruled that Eriksen’s corner had bent out of play during its delivery

Dusan Tadic and Luka Jovic thought they had combined to snatch the opener on 54 minutes, the latter timing his run perfectly to meet Tadic’s pass and slip past Schmeichel only for his effort to be ruled offside
